uses: Using it as a hair accessory - for a unique, edgy look.
Turning it into a mini garden tool for planting small seeds or digging in tight spaces.
Using it as a back scratcher for those hard-to-reach spots.
Creating fork art by dipping the tines in paint and using it to make patterns on paper or fabric.
Using it as a makeshift tool for fishing out small items that have fallen behind furniture or into tight spaces.
Using it as a holder for small candles or tea lights for a rustic, DIY candle holder.
Using it as a tool to help with precision in applying makeup or skincare products.
Turning it into a bookmark by poking it through the pages of a book.
Using it as a tool for sculpting or shaping clay or playdough.
Using it as a makeshift conductive stylus for touchscreen devices.

Repurposing a fork as a hook for hanging keys, jewelry or small kitchen items on a wall.
Using a fork as a makeshift back scratcher for hard-to-reach places.
Creating a fork chandelier by bending and molding multiple forks into a decorative lighting fixture.
Using forks as a stencil for creating patterned designs on paper or fabric.
Making a fork photo holder by bending the tines to create a stand for displaying photos or cards.
Turning a fork into a unique piece of jewelry by bending and shaping it into a bracelet or necklace.
Using a fork as a guide for cutting even slices in cakes or other baked goods.
Using forks as handles for homemade fabric stamps for block-printing designs on clothing or home accessories.
